text:
Bus driver driving roughly - old man fell off seat into aisle - á
driver wouldn't stop - disgusted with her behaviour.

Meeting with two of my friends I had not seen for 15 years. They á
were special people to me.

I was in the Korean War. We were attacked with mortars, me and á
companion. We stopped the jeep and ran for cover. Fortunately á
neither of us was hit but we both came close to being killed.

I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of á
being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at á
work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been á
drinking.

My brother in law was dying of cancer. To see him wasting away á
was very sad.
Disgust at myself when I stroked a sleeping girl's private parts.

When we took out an 84 year old woman for the evening and had á
hamburgers. She described the evening out as her happiest night á
out in 20 years.

While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a á
woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property - á
via a flooded river !

A friend got angry and drove "like a lunatic" with me and others á
in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving.

A boy I look after for the probation service deliberately á
offended to provoke a reaction from the police.

4-letter words on a TV programme (Roche) while we were á
entertaining "conservative" relations who wanted to see the first á
episode.

I was seriously injured in a road accident. The very first steps á
I took with only one crutch to support me I felt so good. I enjoy á
being alive.

I was attacked, standing in a doorway, by a pack of 5 dogs, á
alsatians and farm dogs with my escape route blocked by a shut á
fence.

In the house where I live there is a new flatmate. His friends á
unfortunately are the dirt of society, intelligent, fashonable, á
rich and bored. At a party recently they were doing things I á
didn't like done in my house. I felt angry at them.

I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep á
going because it was late and I would be back in the next few á
days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.

My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most á
expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove á
home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state á
and her actions.

When I found out that a set task (i.e. 2 essays and a test), the á
thought of which had oppressed me, were not on the date I had á
thought.
When confronted and in my opinion hassled by the police.

Disgust - no. Maybe it is more precise to say revultion at a worm á
or a snake. But I mean it in a social aspect when somebody had á
behaved like a scoundrel to you, when by his actions he has made á
you change your attitude towards him but I thing this feeling the á
way I meant it, is not typical for the people interrelations.

When, for example, I was in my eleventh school year and I learned á
I had been classed for the Bulgarian Language and Literature á
National Olympiad.

When, for example, my grandfather fell seriously ill. It was á
necessary for him to be operated and I felt great fear of losing á
him because he is so dear to me.

When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at á
the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and á
in general the best records of all the candidates.

When, for example, I left for the first time my parents and I á
went to live in Sofia.
When, for example, someone is calumnating.

Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the á
worst.
The last time I felt it was when I was coming home late at night.
I haven't often felt this feeling. Once someone stole my garment.
Recently I happened to remain alone for a long time.

I don't remember about a situation when I have experienced this á
feeling. Maybe it was when I saw a drunkard in the street.

Realizing one's desire, an experienced feeling of satisfaction á
from the realization of one's desires and aims.

Fear of the loss of a close friend, of feeling the ground slipping á
from under my feet.

Attitude to some manners of dealing and some "sanctioned" á
relations.

Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent á
as they are when you are young.
Attitude to a related family.
I won a sport contest.
If a close relative's life is in danger.
A close person lied to me.
Getting separated from my girlfriend.
Encouter with a prostitute.
When my son was born.
Before an examination.
Unjust punishment of a friend of mine.
After the loss of a close relative.

When somebody behaves like a scoundrel. Recently a colleague of á
mine used the name of another one for his own benefit.
Meeting a loved man.

I felt a physical fear, if I can call it this way, today, in the bus where á
I was sitting on the first seat. While turning the driver didn't á
see the tram which was making a dash towards us (coming from the á
side I was), and whose driver intended to cross in yellow á
light.

At an unjust, or to be more precise, at a bureaucratic treatment á
of one's personality.
When one is alone and knows that all the others are celebrating.
At the sight of an insect, such as the black-beetle.

I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the á
University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I á
myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When á
the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other á
situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of á
them.

This feeling I sensed quite recently. It was arisen by the á
terrific thought that I might lose the man I loved !

Anger I felt when my boyfriend told me he didn't mind breaking it á
off with me, i.e. each of us to take his own road. Because until á
that moment, he deliberately restricted our dates. The motives á
were brought to my knowledge later.

Sometimes, when I'm alone I am seized by this feeling. But it á
always helps me to come round and at the same time to judge if it á
is worth. Very often this feeling is caused to me by people - á
friends who I love and respect.

Such a feeling springs up in me sometimes when I have meals at a á
catering establishment. It is a result either of the look of the á
food or when watching the way some people eat.
When I was admitted to the University.

I had to have my tonsils out. I had been making up my mind almost á
for a year - I was afraid. But during the two hours in the á
hospital room, while I was waiting to be called for the operation I á
felt a real fear - of the pain, of what they were going to do to á
me, of the unknown.

In a conversation my boyfriend expressed definite and quite á
pretentious opinions and he took up an attitude towards a theory á
which he himself had never known. His information was from á
fortuitous sources.

Summer, heavy rain, storm - I was standing with my face stick to á
the window: the childhood, something was going away forever this á
summer, I was leaving my home, I was going to study in another á
town, for the first time I was leaving my parents, friends, I had á
to manage myself, a long and loved period of my life was over - I á
was crying.
I saw in the street a man spitting.
When I understood that I was admitted to the University.

I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept á
under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a á
half.

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a á
form.
When the man I loved decided to leave me forever.

I have felt this feeling when a person whom I believe and respect, á
lied to me.

A quarrel was followed by the decision of leaving a person close á
to me. Several days later my regret was great. I was beside á
myself. Quite unexpectedly he came and the conflict was calmly á
solved. I was glad at the possibility to be with him.

One evening I was watching the news on TV. Again they were á
talking about the danger of war. Suddenly I imagined what it á
might mean for me, for my friends, for the people close to me. I á
felt it a very near and possible event.

Unfair and unjust attitude toward a person close to me, what I á
was the witness of, caused anger in me.

The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused á
a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form.

I felt disgust with a person whose behaviour was out of the á
elementary human norms.
When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

I broke my knee when I was skiing over "Yastrebetz" (a racing á
track in a Bulgarian winter resort).

The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis á
to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL á
(A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.

My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this á
feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was á
quite strong.

A colleague of mine asked a lecturer to put him a higher mark in á
order to keep his good mards and thus to continue getting a á
scholarship for an excellent grade.

I am a sportwoman as well. I felt joy when after an year of á
practice, at a contest, I covered the norms for "a master of sports".

I felt fear once, when the car in which I travelled directed á
towards the precipice along the road.

When I see how people around me pass by certain unjustice because á
of indifference or cowardice.
When I left a man in whom I really believed.
Disgust with drunk people.
When I was admitted to the University.
When I broke my leg I felt fear.
When someone lies to me.
At an unjust insult or injure.

From the cigarette smoke. Usually I feel disgust from it when I á
am in a restaurant.
When my affairs with the girl I love settled positively.

In a dam lake, when the water was let flow to water the plants á
and I and two other boys were near the water pit. We rescued á
ourselves only thanks to the flippers and the tyre that was with á
us.

It was quite recently, at the football match between the national á
teams of Bulgaria and France. I felt strong anger with the Scottish á
referee who ran the match quite partially.

When I am alone and listen to a song which I like very much and á
which I had listened before together with friends.
A striking act of ingratitude at a public vehicle.

I passed successfully the preliminary exam for a participation in á
the children Assembly.

I was alone in my room at the boarding house when at 12 o'clock á
someone knocked violently on the door.

A friend of mine promised to come with me to the cinema but he á
didn't come.

I felt sadness when I remembered my former boyfriend with whom I á
got separated an year ago and when comparing him with my present á
one with whom things are not much of a success.

Recently in the tram, a man ran his fingers over my girlfriend á
then over me.
Bulgaria won a football match against France.
I was going to knock down a pedestrian with my car.
I was neglected undeservedly.
My grandmother died.
A man was unfair to a girlfriend of mine.
I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.

The night before my wife had given birth to our twins. I felt á
fear in the hospital yard, I feared if everything was going to be á
in order.

About a month ago the Regional Council refused to pay my wife the á
due maternity benefit, because of bureaucratic reasons.

Some months ago my wife gave birth to twin sisters. She had no á
idea of looking after babies and she felt quite oppressed. The á
fact that I couldn't help her caused grief to me.

I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable á
of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in á
the tram.

The period when I was pregnant and when I gave birth to my son. á
I can say those were the happiest months in my life.

A fear from the loss of a close friend as a result of his á
behavior.

When I encountered not only with my father's lack of á
understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as á
a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be á
right are concerned.
From the fact that my husband and I are not in good terms.

I was disgusted from a quarrel between two married people, in á
which the children were involved as accusers of one of the á
parents.

I felt joy when I saw my daughter after a separation of twenty á
days.

I felt fear when I sat for one of my exams. Though my fear was á
not quite justifiable, I still remember about it.

I thought him a good friend but he tried to lie to me several times. á
Last time was the height of impudence. He promised he would come á
home but he didn't. I felt a sense of anger and insult.
A fear of lack of personal powers.

At an undeserved attitude toward a man, when human personality is á
not treated decently.
At an irrevocable loss (with respect to human relations).

At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity and á
mostly at a philistinism.
When I was admitted to the University.

Because of a conflict with my parents there was a possibility to á
interrupt my studies.
I feel a strong anger when I am treated unjustly.
At a prolonged separation with my family.

I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of á
a rat.
The day when my son said for the first time "mummy".
Before an exam in logics.

My husband and I were invited at the house of our nieghbours then á
we got an invitation on the part of my parents which we had to á
refuse. A a result they called me by words that provoked my á
anger.

My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers á
having walks with their children.

The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to á
my norms of behaviour.

The sense of joy comes to me always after a period of depression, á
as an organic feeling for an upsurge. I don't exclude the á
situative feeling but in this case the reason is not in me, it's á
out of me.

I bet that I would jump down from a window. I was sure that I á
would jump but before I did it I rather felt fear.

A honest "sliding" on the part of a girlfriend of mine. á
Terribly crossed I started breaking things and tearing books.

Alone I am coming back home in the night after the serial á
"explanation".
A lie on the part of a person close to me.
My son was born.
I had a car accident.

I was drawn up a statement for an infringement of the traffic á
ordinance. In fact I was innocent.
I lost a close friend.

I saw a film about the nazi concentration camps during the war. á
After the film I felt disgust.

After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I á
passed my last exam.
Before going to the dentist.

When I am made to do things in which I see no sense and I waste á
my time. Some time ago I had to participate in a sociological á
investigation and then I got really angry.

When I feel I must be with somebody, to talk with somebody - but á
I am alone.

Some time ago a man tried to teach me something. "Tried" because á
it is very difficult to teach somebody when you yourself are not á
competent and cultured.

When I am with friends and I do what pleases me this often á
happenes.

When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person á
with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

I unfairly got a low mark on an exam and I failed to win a grant, á
since then I don't have much confidence in myself at an exam.
It happened that I was alone - with no contacts with friends.

I met three drunk boys, almost children, they didn't look like á
normal people.

I was happy when I understood that the girl I liked was in love á
with me.
I am afraid before an exam or colloquium.

I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent á
words.
When my dog was stolen.

I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder á
people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or á
moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of á
mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very á
loudly and threatened that with "connections" she will expel me á
from the inst.
When I met with friends that I hadn't seen for a long time.

One evening a friend of mine was telling a fearful story, nobody á
took it seriously but I got frightened.

I got angry with a stranger in a train who behaved impertinently á
and immorally
When I failed at the first entrance exam.
The event which got me angry got also an aversion in me.

Six months ago when I got acquaintanced with a person whom I á
trusted infinitely and from whom I expected help and friendly á
feelings. With him I found much in common - in our views and in á
our fate.

Few days ago I really experienced fear. It was connected with á
unexpected actions on the part of a group of people. This evoked á
in me many negative emotions.

I always get angry when somebody deceives me, or tries to conceal á
his lie skilfully and this offends me even more.

Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often á
recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my á
general impression from severl situations which evoked this á
feeling in me.

I became disgusted with the man on whom I had counted, who I had á
trusted, the man who should have been my mainstay - my father. á
I could hardly make myself (and the others) believe in this á
emotion. It has cumulated after events and deeds. Everything can á
happen in this world.
When I was accepted as a student.

I was a bit frightened when it was found that there was something á
wrong with my liver. However it turned out that it was not á
serious and I need not worry.

With the girl whom I may be loved truly. When she refused to come á
with me to an occasion (she was from another town).

For the girl who halped me go on living and made me happy - when á
I don't see her even for two or three days.

For a drunk man (about 20 years old) that I met one evening, and á
who behaved impudently with the girls standing by.

I felt it when on duty in the hospital I understood that I was á
not afraid to face death, that I also helped a little to relieve á
the pains of a patient.

Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw á
another one, as if out of control of the driver.

I felt it when a girl who was dear to me lied to my face. I got á
angry with the fact that she knew I didn't believe her but she á
kept on telling lies.
Sadness, no, I felt something much stronger when my father died.

I got disgusted with a man who was beating a woman in the street. á
I just happened to be there but I was abhorred by the rudness.
When I knew that my husband and I were going to have a child.

Two years ago I saw a film on the TV. Even now it makes me á
afraid.
When my husband stays late at a meeting and I have to be alone.
The loss of a person I loved very much.
Deception from a person I loved very much.

I was very happy when I got the message that I had been accepted á
as a student in medicine.

I felt something close to that when I saw that there was a man on á
the terrace of the flat.

I got angry when I learned how short a time we had to prepare for á
the term examinations.

I felt sad when my first boyfriend and I left each other. It was neither á
his fault nor mine.

I felt it today when the bus driver shouted rather indecent words á
at a man without any reason whatsoever.

When I learned that my parents were going abroad and leaving me á
alone for a few years.

I was at the seaside and my brother disappeared for a couple of á
hours.

Some time ago I was disgusted with the "cleanness" of the á
refectory of our institute.

When I was admitted to the Institute. I had problems with many á
people about my applying for this institute and I decided to á
prove that one can pass excellently without visiting any á
preparatory couse. That is - I proved what I could do on my own.

Once as a child I dreamed of a fire. Since that time I hadn't á
wanted to sleep in that bed and had feared the night darkness á
(and so it is now).

A chief was unjustly punished on an autumn brigade and the one á
who was really guilty kept silent. I stepped in front and told á
the truth. The guilty chief called me in after the roll-call and á
threatened me.

Years ago I fell in love for the first time. as natural for every á
school-girl I was day-dreaming. Later (after 3 years) we left á
each other. No one was to blame but I felt deep sadness. Even now á
I remember about it quite often.

It was at a comsomol(??) meeting, the last one because we were to á
graduate. The way one of my fellow-students behaved made me feel á
disgusted.

When I learned I was admitted to study what I wanted most - á
floriculture (this is a narrow specialization from the general á
one).

I was walking on the pavement when a white car rolled on it and á
directed towards me. I was quite near the house wall when it á
rolled by and hit me.

My grandmother's brother had taken active part in the resistance á
movement. He had been in prison many times and there he lost his á
health. He became an invalid. When we phoned to First Aid the á
nurse on duty behaved quite unkindly when she understood how old á
he was (79).

My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we á
had to get separated again.

I felt disgusted about a teacher who had rejected all that was á
human in her. She refused to accept the flowers we gave her for á
the eighth of March and asked for a foreign parfume instead.

I was very glad when I learned I was a student already. I heard á
about it over the phone, I didn't believe it at first.
I had worries about a certain illness.

I suffered from a gynaecological illness. I was quite displeased á
to hear that my roommates had talked about it and they had á
misrepresented the truth. I felt deeply hurt when I learned that á
it was done by a "good" acquaintance of mine.

When my first boyfriend left me. I tried not to let him á
understand I felt miserable.

I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my á
affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if á
nothing had happened.

I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry á
examination.

This was what I felt when my boyfriend went to Bourgas to study á
there. I had the feeling I would lose him. Anyway the distance á
Plovdiv-Bourgas seemed to me so great.

I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, á
the pedology lecturer was the cause.

This feeling was quite deep when my friend (girl) died in a car á
accident.

I am disgusted with the behavior of a car driver whose car would á
run over me and my friends during our autumn brigade.

I sensed a strong feeling of joy when in the plant, at my working á
place, I got a message that I was admitted as full time student at á
the Higher Agricultural Institute.

Fear when fulfilling my obligations on my first night fatigue á
duty as a soldier.

When on a car journey a fellow student crossed our way with his á
own car and we had to bump into a roadside trunk.
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

I am disgusted with a nieghbour who is looking for all sorts of á
quarrel with my parents and me. He feels we are hampering his á
living close to us. This has been going on for quite a long time.

After a difficult exam. When I had not hoped to take it and had á
got a high mark. When you present someone with something and he á
feels glad.

Fear from the unknown. I felt fear when I sat for the entrance á
examinations.

I feel angry at people's indifference at our ability to be á
present at an event and to stay partial to what happens.

When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for á
my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of á
childhood.
I feel disgusted with the bootlickers, with helpless people.

I was sitting for an exam in biochemistry, I was very excited á
because it was a supplementary examination. I passed the exam á
very well and was glad because I recovered my selfconfidence.

Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations á
most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my á
microbiology exam, because it was a decisive one.

It was necessary to organise a competition in connection with a á
celebration. Everyone was to be present at that event. It turned á
out that there was no audience at all because everyone had á
pretended to be very intelligent and no one had come. I got á
furious.

When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I á
can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just á
parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

In autumn I had to move to another lodging. My landlords, quite á
intelligent people, warned me I had to move in the nearest á
future. But I had difficulties in moving my luggage because I á
couldn't wait for a car to come. How amazed I was to hear them á
threatening me they would throw our my things. And at that my á
luggage was well packed and did not stand in their way. I was á
quite  disappointed and disgusted.

When I succeded in establishing a contact with a girl (who is now á
my girlfriend).
I fear before each exam.
When my bosom friend tried to lie to me.
When I quarrelled with a very close friend of mine.
When I see the acts and deeds of a blind drunk man.

I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in á
February.

It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk á
and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. á
I felt fear of what could have happened.

I felt anger at my last exam, I felt angry with our teacher, á
because he did not rate me objectively and I failed.

I met a girl some time ago and I cared very much about her but it á
happened so that we left each other. I felt some sort of sadness, I think á
I can call it so.

I had a very good friend (boy) and I thought I could rely on him á
but he behaved badly with a girl who used to trust us completely.
When I was admitted to the Higher Institute.

I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I á
could not feel it at all.

I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a á
few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.

When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia á
and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the á
events that were taking place there.

I felt disgust with alcohol in general when a close friend of á
mine got so drunk that he didn't realize what he was doing and it á
was quite shameful.

I felt joy when I was admitted to the Higher Agricultural á
Institute.

I feel fear quite often but this feeling was very strong last á
year when my husband was quite unexpectedly sent to the hospital.

That was what I felt with a teacher who put down quite unreal á
marks.

I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something á
had irrevocably gone away from me.

I felt disgust with a lady teacher who used to nag, to mock, to á
interrupt everyone of my fellow students each time we had a class á
with her in our first year.

I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my á
sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the á
telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and á
told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

I faced this feeling when I realized I wasn't admitted to the á
institute in the first classifying, in spite of the high mark I á
had got at the entrance examination.á

Always when I get separated from my friends and relatives from my á
home town.

I feel disgust with my first boyfriend who made fun of our love á
in an abominable way.

Naturally when I got myself discharged this was my second á
birthday.
When I failed my first exam at the Higher Institute.

A nuisance used to live in our flat a month ago. I experienced á
this feeling when I tried to chase her out.
After my father's death.
With an alcoholic.

I felt the greatest burst of joy when after being heavily ill for á
a long period, my father came back home.

I was terrified during an axcursion in Italy. I was lost and left á
alone in this unfamiliar country.

I took part in a football match. The referee was extremely á
partial to the opposite team. This stirred up my discontent and á
anger.
When my first girlfriend an I left each other.

During a summer holiday at a bar I happened to see a dead to the á
world woman.

When I got a message that I was employed as a nurse at a á
kindergarten.
When I first sat for an entrance examination.

When a teacher though pretending to be a highly cultivated á
teacher and a man, slapped a classmate of mine in the face quite á
undeservedly.
When I got separated from my first love.

Many times, when my father used to come home drunk and maltreated á
physically me and my mother.

Being invited out by a person I wished to get closer to. He á
telephoned and invited me to go out with him the next night.
Watching a horror movie with friends.

The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad á
then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

The funeral of a friend who was killed in a car accident. She was á
of my own age, there were many of my own friends present, as well á
as her family etc.

Disgust for a person who treated me badly, and has treated other á
people similarly - including lying, hiding facts, being á
deceitful, unfair, etc.

Achievement of a task by a friend who had begun a new job. She á
wasn't confident of handling the situation so was thinking  of á
leaving the job only after 2 days employment.

Walking home at night after university - part of the way, there á
are ano lights and I am walking down a thoroughfare with the á
thouth of no one hearing me if I have to scream.

When my son omits to carry out certain duties at home that he á
knows needs doing.

When I saw my niece (5 yrs) crying in the hallway for her mother á
who had passed away about a month ago.

With a woman who had walked into my place of employment and á
urinated on the floor in front of everyone.

Felt joy a few years ago when I was away on holiday. And sat very á
close to my best friend looking straight into the eyes.

I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate á
and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited á
sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear á
through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings á
despite my own being hurt in the process.

In a sociology class I felt very angry towards some members of á
society for exploiting the Polynesian people, dawn raids by á
Police (Martin Luther King, Blacks in S.A.). But this was just a á
reflection of my own shortcomings.

Felt sad about some street kids in QUEII square, Aotea square. á
Because they had been sniffing glue and some were very young. I á
went into the role of a performing clown.

I was disgusted by my paranoid attitude towards myself, my á
homework at university and disgusted about my lack of retention. á
Especially in learning another language.

When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing á
well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd á
taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last á
3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for á
Council.

A Maori language oral test, yeaterday - Although I had studied á
intensely - once in the examiners room "I blew it" -  I was so á
nervous I couldn't reply easily - It was very important, but I á
got only blankness.

A friend visited and made comments that my house/garden were not á
as neat/tidy as in the past. I'd not seen her a year - She á
implied I'd gone to the pack (I'd only been working full time, á
and taking 3 University exams part time).

When my father a 4th/5th generation colonial (from Eng.) attacked á
me verbally about my chosen partner. A man whom he discarded á
because his colour skin was not white. His ultimate disgust á
saddned me.

People who came to our home - and requested "Put out your smoke". á
That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even á
politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to á
the situation.
My 3 children - each top his class in the final exams 1984.

A truck (big one) nearly mowed me off the road (I was driving a á
small Lazer).

A shop in Downtown wouldn't accept my Visa Card - before December á
last year.

My dog of 16 and 1/2 years - "Lord Grey" died in his sleep - His á
death caused me more and deeper sadness than I thought.
A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.
When my daughter was born.

When my mother entered surgery for a quadruple heart bypass. I á
felt intense fear at the time she was actually wheeled away.

When my husband got picked up in our new car for drunken driving. á
We had made a pact the other would not drink and so therefore á
would be the driver for the evening etc. I was not present at the á
time.
When my grandmother died very suddenly without warning.

When the N.Z. rugby union announced that they would proceed with á
a rugby tour of South Africa.

Being reunited with my family after not having seen them for 5 á
years, at the airport. Sheer elation at getting through the á
"paper work" collecting bags and the anticipation of coming á
through the customs gate.

I caught a huge eel on a fishing line which I had pulled into the á
boat. I cut the line and threw the whole lot back into the water. á
Later that day and about ten miles away I went swimming and á
someone made the comment wondering how far eels could swim, I á
abruptly ended swimming for fear at an unseen eel for a few days á
until we had left the district.

My partner without discussing with me the situation decided it á
was time for us to have a break and went ahead and arranged his á
own life for the next 6-12 months, then told me the day before it á
was about to happen having been tolerant and friendly for the á
preceding week.

I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to á
leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole á
new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and á
traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I á
wouldn't see many of them again.

After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was á
scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want á
a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way á
through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and á
continue my studies.

This situation keeps occurring - when my little sister disagrees á
with me or vice-versa. We have very similar temperaments and I á
always end up feeling angry at her and myself for fighting so á
much over unimportant trivial matters.

When my grandmother, who has been living with us for 14 years, á
had a stroke and was left paralysed on one side. She has been á
quite close to our family and to see her suffer in this way makes á
me feel really sad.

A gathering of a social sports club at which they proceeded to á
show pornographic videos and then afterwards (when most people á
had had quite a bit to drink) carried on in a very degrading, á
unmoral manner - especially females exposing and flaunting á
themselves with no shame or embarassment.

My mother along with some of my friends gave me a surprise á
birthday party - they invited a large number of my friends along á
too.

My mother did not come home till late at night (Ages ago). Anyway á
if I don't know where my parents are and when they'll be back I á
start thinking that perhaps they have had an accident and are á
perhaps dead.

Because I am the Captain of a basketball team I usually organise á
a roster system so that everyone in the team can have a turn at á
doing either a duty or a ref. A lot of the time the girls can't á
be bothered or just forget - I usually have to fill in.

So as to be closer to the university I have left home and moved á
into Auckland. It now seems as if I have left home - especially á
my family - forever.

A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but á
is quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.

Passing my pharmacy exams which meant my tertiary education for á
pharmacy completed.

When I was in a car with my parents and friends and we had to á
back up (reverse) pass a river which when I recall it (I was only á
about 5 yrs) seemed we were going to fall in and drown.

When my boyfriend wouldn't dance with me on my graduation night á
because he thought I could dance with my friends who were á
friendly.

When my sister (really my niece) died of cancer at the age of 2 á
yrs after I took her to the doctor at the age of 1 and he á
diagnosed it.

My brother gave me a beating because he could not beat me á
verbally.

Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special á
occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my á
family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process á
which have been going on for centuries.

I had this experience of fear when few people were fighting at a á
social one night, which one of my relative was involved. My fear á
was greatly for him because he was being assaulted badly.
Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.

This occurred when my girlfriend and I have to finish our á
relationship due to some circumstances between her and her á
family. I was really sad, hurt and couldn't really find any á
reason why am I still living. Is this life is all about ? This á
was one of few question which crept up vividly every time I á
thought about what had happened.

I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body with á
drugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usually á
for an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they do á
things stupidly and unjustly.
Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e., ill feeling.
Had fear of losing husband.

When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self - á
to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a future á
daughter-in-law.
When boyfriend could not stand up to his mother or for himself.

Disgusted with boyfriend's mother - her overpowering, á
over-protecting and selfish attitudes.

My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really á
happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me á
made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another á
person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she á
asked me.

That if ever I was really naughty I would be sent away from my á
Mum and Dad to another family. I was fostered from age 5 and á
didn't get to Mum and Dad until I was 6 and then legally adopted á
at 14.

(1) My father died. (2) My natural father contacted me a year á
after my father died and this angered me more as I thought he á
should be dead and not my father.

My father died. I was away at the time and did not know until two á
days after.

A child told me she had been sexually abused by her step-father. á
I only knew the child and had not come into contact with either á
parent. I tried to do what was best for the child. The event and á
the stepfather disgusted me.
Joy at meeting a woman I love very much.
When approached by a gang of youths in town at night.

When a man, a stranger to me, personally insulted a close woman á
friend of mine in public.
After my father died suddenly of a heart attack.

When a man spoke very sexistly in the company of some friends of á
mine.

When my lover and I felt like we had gone full circle. And our á
relationship was new, fresh, vital etc. once again.

My daughter was 2 yrs she went up to a colt tried to hit it. It á
turned on her and kicked her over the heart, sent her flying á
through the air. I left my mother and sister to deal to her as á
they are nurses. I felt I didn't want to know if she was going to á
die, it was just too much.
My anger is with men, their inability to be human (not all men).

The saddest I've ever been was when my lover was killed, á
hitch-hiking to work.

With the N.Z. Rugby Union wanting to send the All Blacks to South á
Africa.

A good friend, the wife of the vicar of my church came up to me á
from the pews (I am in the choir) and shook my hand during the á
time for an informal "greeting" in the church service. She said a á
few words.

I walked up the main street of Auckland at 10 o'clock at night. I á
expected it to be very active with people, gangs, fast cars etc, á
thought it was actually quite quiet, though also oppressive. I á
walked about half a mile and bought a drink along the way.

Someone in my family (my brother I suspected) ate a bun which I á
had made for myself. It was during a long telephone call after I á
had just made it and put it in the oven warming drawer.

Sitting in a bus, I heard behind, the voice of a girl I was á
friendly with. After her talking for some time with another girl á
I decided it wasn't her in fact that someone miming her, which it á
was when I finally looked. I was talking to a friend at the time.

Having moved into a flat within the last week I felt some disgust á
that a bathroom tap had been left to drip with a faulty fawcet.

My friend replying to my letter and again saying he was attracted á
to me and suggesting we write, talk and get together and see how á
things went and his suggestion that I could ring and doing that it á
was really good - though really insane conversation.

Being sexually assaulted (not rape, but passionate kissing) by a á
friend's father - he stopped when he was driving me home. I á
hadn't wanted the lift, had refused 3 times, and then felt it'd á
be rude to refuse again. Was really afraid of what he might do.

I live by myself and a few weeks ago was woke by a man on the end á
of my bed coming up my bed at me. I was really angry, told him to á
get out. He was surprised, hesitated; I started to move towards á
him and he backed off - kept telling him - loudly, but firmly to á
go. Because I'd got the initiative, I succeeded. A very powerful á
message.

When my grandmother died - I wasn't sad so much that she'd died á
because she was old, but because she lived in the last few years á
in an old people's home and had nothing very much that was hers - á
no chair, or private space, and when I went to visit she would be á
sitting in the "lliving" room the TV room. It was hopeless. And I á
felt awkward so I didn't go and I was sad 'cos how I couldn't.

When during a social evening with my father, brother, sister, á
close friend and my father's 2nd wife - I had an argument with my á
father, who abused my friend who was sticking up for me.

When the girl whom I have lusted after expressed reciprocal á
feelings and then days later changed her mind.
When a close friend wilfully cheated me.

Girlfriend arriving back from overseas and picking her up from á
airport. When she finally appeared from customs and we came in á
contact again.

Fear of punishment for having broken an item of value to my á
parents.

That a friend had been badly beaten and stabbed many times and á
the person that did it got away without any punishment from the á

The death of an animal we had reared.

Finding that a girlfriend of mine was a prostitute and had been á
seeing many others during our relationship.

The feeling of joy when again I had confessed my sin and á
experienced God's forgiving grace and cleansing power - total á
enlightenment and freedome - bliss.

Riding through a bush fire on an island of Australia - on a á
pushbike as a little boy - all alone, lost and surrounded by á

When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close á
- I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reacted á

My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down - á
no one else there to do it.

When someone I had had a relationship (purely sexual) with came á
up to me after I had used her and acted as if nothing had á
changed.

First time I slept with my present girlfriend. Had been best á
friends for a year but had been hesitant about getting involved á

Waiting for a taxi - when within 1/2 an hour two separate people á

Deliberately provoked by someone close. Angered by the á
deliberation not the provocation.

My girlfriend let me down badly 3 times in one week. These á
instances summed up all the negative aspects of our relationship á
which at the time seemed doomed to fail.
A close friend took part in a racist violent action.

Hearing that I had been successful in getting a position whereby á
my financial, physical, spiritual and emotional needs will be á

last five years of my life.

When I decided to leave my steady, secure employment to come to á
university. Because I didn't know if I could cope with all the á
requirements of study and also being older I didn't know if I á
would enjoy mixing with younger people, also financial á
insecurity.

When a close friend failed to live up to the expectations I had á
of him - thereby causing pain to his spouse. I believe that my á
anger was probably a reaction of fear that I wouldn't be able to á
live up to my own expectations.

Departure of a very close friend - for a long stay overseas, á
sharing in the sorrow of her parents who were left behind.

I get disgusted with the inherent racist attitudes of my á
brother-in-law in putting down various ethnic groups and also my á

keep the peace.
Hearing Fran Wilde introduce the Bill.

Being harrassed for being gay; suggestions of being physically á

Landlord putting up rents sneakly and slimily.

Listening and watching a tape of someone with AIDS being á
prejudiced against at a counselling course on AIDS with 20 á

Hearing Norman Jones get hysterical in Parliament about law á

Won a prize for effort.
Assaulted by drunken neighbour.

I was playing in a football tournament and saw the rules openly á
disregarded.
Death of brother.
Reading literature on AIDS/homosexuality.

I was feeling really low - had been a series of fights with my á
siblings, been under pressure at school and wasn't going to the á
party I wanted to go - instead I was going out with my family. A á
guy called and said, in effect, that I was "nice" and he liked á
me. Hence the emotional joy.

I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music á
was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And a light flashed á
on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre á
that was almost empty.

My sister and I were fighting as usual. She's older tham I am, á
bigger built and stronger I couldn't win in a physical battle and á
in a verbal battle I couldn't seem to get through to her to á
really hurt her.

My paternal grandmother had died. We weren't close but she was á
blood. I didn't cry but I was sad, partly due to her death and á

My older sister used to pick on my brothers and sisters all of á
whom were younger than her. On one occasion my brother did á
something my sister didn't like. A full-scale battle began.

Winning a rowing race at a Karapiro regatta. With 7 other á
friends.

Being alone in Europe and having to catch a train and bus to the á
airport, then board the plane alone.

At school teacher for not allowing us to go out on New Year's Eve á
when on a class trip overseas.

I was in a car accident on the way back from a weekend rowing á
regatta we'd won. 5 others were in the car. I thought I'd never á
be able to row again.
Our boarder burping after meals !

When I won a position on the track-team for the trans-tasman á
games when I was eleven.
When I was jumped by three men in a deserted area.

Once a person in authority (school teacher) was telling blatant á
lies about me and the headmistress would not let me defend á
myself. She was also telling lies about other members of my á
family.
When my mother died.

When somebody who had been a bully and had acted cruelly to á
others who were unable to defend themselves was taken down a few á
notches and he began to grovel. I was disgusted with his á

Easter holiday - I had been working weekends and had just left.
Haven't been frightened for ages.

I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a á
policy of strict positive - negative reinforcement to the á
children involved. Children who measured up to his standards were á

I felt sad with the two situations I described before. The cat á
and the school. Sadness was intermingled with the other feelings.

Next door nieghbour ran over his cat in driveway, he tried to á
finish it off with a flat shovel. I would have taken cat to á

Getting my kitten, found at work several years ago, taking him á

Obscene phone call where the person knew my name.
At work being shifted to another area.

Enrolling at varsity, being told I couldn't get in to certain á
papers.
Noticing my flat had maggotts !

When I was finally able to return to a job that I enjoyed doing á
after several months absence (I was not needed during this time).
When I was attacked by a teenage boy and had my wallet stolen.

Someone who was speeding was forced to slow down when I pulled á
out onto the road and proceeded to abuse me at the next set of á

When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and I á
was unable to see this person because of the situation.

When someone whom I considered my friend, without telling me he á

apparent reason.

At my wedding - standing with the man I love and acknowledging á

As a result of breaking the indicator light as mentioned á
for guilt.

Arriving home from work after a long and tiring day to find no á

At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurred á

With a Manager who insists on making crude innuendos pertaining á

Waking in morning (early morning) and having whole day to myself.

Being driven by friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little. á
It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of road.

Friend (male) hinted that my talking to other men at a pub was á
immoral. He implied that I should remain only with my boyfriend á
the entire evening.
On rising. No apparent reason.

Prolonged "niggling" of friend on a single theme which I á
considered of no consequence.
When my first niece was born.

In a flat in Sydney - rough area at home on my own - the flat had á
been burgled the night before and no way of locking the door.
When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.
When my uncle died of leukemia at age 35.

Watching an alcoholic woman who was approaching everyone at the á
wharf for cigarettes - a prostitute in Auckland (elderly).

When I went to the pub with a large group of friends, we drank á
and danced.
Watched a horror movie which involved sexual attacks on women.

My boyfriend promised to take me to see a game of tennis and rang á
saying he was going to the pub with some of his friends instead.

My mother was unwell and went for many cancer tests. She spent á
time in hospital being opened and closed many times.

I was driving along and saw this young guy urinating into the á
gutter, in broad daylight.
Birth of children.
Being alone at night.
In a hurry to get to lectures and the car would not start.
When grandfather died.
Obscene phone calls.
Thought had discovered true love.

Stopped at lights in Mangere late one Friday night on way home á
from work. Alone in car when someone came up behind the car and á
started banging and shaking it. Light was red and had nowhere to á
go until light changed. When green I took off.

When fired unjustly from a job as casual bar-person. Charged with á
giving away free drinks. Not done so and had witnesses to prove á
it - both patrons and bar staff. Other staff were supportive.

Close friend leave to go overseas for an indefinite period. á
Farewell scene at airport.
When employer made a pass at me whilst I was at work.

Receiving understanding from within self of a subject I had á

To talk in a meeting - expound my thoughts on a subject. Fear á

Towards wife's laziness in not performing her usual duties á

Watching suffering in Third World country.

Observation of people lost in the profit motive - i.e. business á

Meeting best friend at the airport (boyfriend) who I had missed á

Confronted outside a party by some very nasty character - á
gesturing to a car full of mean-acting friends - felt in danger.
NO RESPONSE.
My cat died painfully and slowly.

Having unwanted attention paid to me in my place of work - á
harrassment (and sexual harrassment) by another worker - á
disgusted by his implications.

I was very pleased and happy when my older sister came home from á

I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist and á

My parents didn't allow me to go to a social function that all my á
friends were attending.

While still at school a friend died of cancer, after being ill á

At a party my best girlfriend got really drunk and went off with á
a guy she knows I really like.

When my brother who has been out of New Zealand for 10 years came á
to visit with his wife which none of our family had previously á
met.

When I had to give a speech about some historical event, to an á

In arguments with a close friend or relative where my point of á
view is completely disregarded.

When my grandfather whom I had met only once for 3 weeks, died á
after several months. I was really sad because he was a lovely á
person and I did not have the means for his company.

I once saw a programme on TV describing how certain wild life á

When my former boyfriend and I reconciled and he decided that I á
was very important to him. I had always wanted us to get back á

When riding in a very fastly-driven car on a lose metal road at a á
very late hour - no other cars on road, and driver was taking á

happened, the area was very isolated. Also, I feared for driver, á

When at very short notice I agreed to work in place of a friend á
who was sick, and owner of the restaurant refused to allow me a á

When I learned that my former boyfriend had become engaged - á
although I was glad that he had found what he wanted, I was very á

one day reconcile.

When reading a newspaper story of a man who had committed á
incestuous acts on his two-year old child - the thought that á
anyone could do such a thing is abhorrent to me.

I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot á
licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a á
natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses á
and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck á
and it was a real adventure.

A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Island á
by ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals - á
they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All of á
them were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and were á
totally terrified. Eventually these guys gave up and went looking á
for us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2 á
nights.

I "cooked" the engine in my father's car - it was actually his á
fault because he hadn't fixed the temperature gauge or told me. á
When I finally got home I was absolutely screamed at and the á
anger I experienced was over the injustice of it all plus the á
huge row which developed.

This sounds really predictable and usual but it was absolutely á
heart-rending at the time. My first lover (I was 15) just rang up á
one day and announced that he had found another woman. I never á
saw him again and it hurt because I was positive that it was á
"TRUE LOVE" !!

I once saw an old man up the road, fossicking through the rubbish á
bins and the gutter. I was really disgusted at first but I've á
seen him a few times since then and now I feel really sorry for á
him and I often give him cigarettes when I see him, because he á
mainly goes after cigarette butts and it is revolting.

A holiday at a whitesand deserted beach. A cool evening near the á
end of summer and we had a fire in the sand - toasted á
marshmellows, cuddled and drank champagne.

Skiing down a very icy slope, very fast in white-out conditions. á
Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I was á
heading.

My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing á
and went out with him herself.

I found a baby opposum on the road and took it home and cared for á
it for a week. It had to be force-fed and carried in a fur pouch á
under my jersey. My father had the vet put it to sleep as he said á
they carried diseases.

A boyfriend with whom I split up with came over to a friend's á
house where I was visiting with a male friend. In a confrontation á
in another room he tried to find out if I was aroused by my á
friend by feeling my parts.

Winning a race that I had been training for, for many weeks. á
(Running Race).

When I was very young and we moved as a family to Auckland from á
Wellington, this meant new school and friends (etc.).

When someone ignores what I am saying or doesn't let me have my á
point of view and they monopolise a conversation.

When I got into an argument with someone and was very abusive, á
but they were a close friend and I later regretted it.

When a close relative got quite drunk. It was a relative that I á
had respected for a long time and looked up to as a child.

Listening to the opening bars of Tchaikovsdy's symphony No.2 á
fourth movement at my sister's wedding.

As a passenger in a vehicle travelling from the steep side of á

chasms to one side, sheer face to the other.
As in sadness (A), relating to this slaghter of fur-seals.

A) A documentary in which baby fur seals were being á
clubbed/spiked to death by Canadian seal-hunters. Brutally á
graphic.
B) Description of a disfigured orphaned child in Hiroshima á
calling for her mother.

The repression of rioting and non-rioting "Blacks" in South á
Africa by the police of that "Democracy".

Seeing my sister after about 2 years of not seeing her. Only á
spent 1 hour or so before she was off overseas with her husband á
for 3 months.

I imagined I heard footsteps up the hall while sleeping in bed á
one night by myself in the house.

Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wanted á
to fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one of á
my friends.

My father recently having a heart attack - spending a few months á
in hospital.

My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with another á
close friend of mine.
Talking with someone I admire a lot.
Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.

Came back from surfing to find car broken into and gear and money á
stolen.
Caused a family disturbance.
Friends calling me fat - pear shaped in front of a nice girl.

Mugged while on holiday in the U.S.A.

Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told á

A drunk walked out in front of a car at night. Both lower legs á

Canoeing across harbour in winds - 20 knots and rising seas.

I lent a text-book to a person I did not know very well, they á

Getting University Entrance accredited and arriving home from á

Thinking that I had been seen smoking at school by a teacher - á

Most recently when the chairman at the New Zeeland Rugby Union á

In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the á

Sleeping alone in a tent, while hearing several noises such as á

A piece of work was marked as bad by the teachers I and some á

It was a complex situation concerning a relationship with a á

When someone accuses me without reason and is not willing to á

A person I know who tells lies and so pretending to be better á

I can't give one description here. I often feel joyful when I á

A good friend deceived me. Because of that little quarrel our á

I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.

When my boyfriend came back after being away for 10 days.
When I was sitting in a car next to a man who was masturbating.

Tonight in bed when I realised how bad my relationship with my á

When I was making music together with my friend. It sounded very á

When my cat ran under a car and came home wounded. He could á

I had to unscrew something on my car. I didn't succeed after two á

Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this á

A few days ago I saw two dandy girls of my age. I disliked their á

At an important moment in a volleyball game we made a point and á

When I went out with my dog in a forest late at night when we á

I had an appointment with someone at a certain time. The other á

When my friends left without waiting for me, after we had arranged á

When they gave away my dog to other people without my knowledge.

On the scenic railway at the fairground.
At having an argument with a stranger, in the street.

One day, when I was a child, my grandmother shut me up in a room.

I found myself involved in a fight in which a person died and I á

An argument among friends in which my opinions on the way to á

When I passed the last exam, which I had doudts about.

When I heard about the treatment of a friend in jail. Really á

When on holiday in Greece I called my best friend, she told me á

My father was very angry with me, and I locked me up in the á

When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hours á

When I watched TV and saw a performance of "Prince" (a popidol). á

If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my á

 Before going in to see it I was afraid as it was the first time á

When a close relative of mine passed away, it was the first time á

My fiancT left me for my best friend.

A recurrent lovesickness.

Meddlesomeness of my mother about the way I live. She thinks I am á

Disappointed love. The girl made an end to our relationship while á

I have high expectations for my future but if I pursue the á

An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all his á
life, got a cerebral hemorrhage.

A student who lives in the same house where I live is an alcoholic. He á
tries to manipulate other people with his money when he has drunk á
too much.
When I got my drivers licence.

When I stayed alone in a house in Great Brittain and there was a á
lot of rumour in the newspaper about a murderer still being free.
The stories about the way my grandmother treated my mother.
When my mother was proved to suffer from a very serious disease.

The stories about my aunt who was beaten and humiliated by my á
uncle.

Every year during carnival I am very joyful I have an intense á
feeling of happiness then.

The only event I can remember is having a nightmare when I was á
very young (3 years old) I dreamt about a machine which was going á
to crush me.

I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace á
when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves á
that I have fallen in love with him.

Losing a boyfriend for the second time to my friend. He fell in á
love with her. The same thing happened a few months earlier with á
another boyfriend.

There is a person whom I disgust. Evrey time I see her I get this á
terrible feeling I disgust her whole appearance.

When I came again in contact with a girl I liked very much. And á
most important she also liked me.
DO NOT REMEMBER.

After a hard day at the university I also had to make dinner that á
evening. It failed because of a frying pan which broke.
When my father had a cerebral hemorrhage.

A story I heard recently about a baby dying after sexual á
abuse.

When an old schoolfriend phoned me to arrange an appointment to á
talk about old memories. I hadn't seen him for 8 years.

Standing in a crowed shop or in a closed room with too much á
people in it. This gives me a fearful experience.

My older brother who gives me unwanted advices about problems in á
my relationship with my girlfriend.

My girlfriend left the house in which we lived together a few á
months ago. This made me very sad.

When my parents behave very "witty" towards me, they make insipid á
jokes about which they laugh. Or my mother who treats me like a á
little child.

Occurs frequently. A recent experience: when going out with many á
friends, nice music, after the examinations, I felt so happy I á
could have embraced everybody.

I lived alone in a repulsive area in the city of Rotterdam. I was á
annoyed, heard a lot of Burglary and assaults. Especially in the evening á
and the night I frequently felt anxious.
Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.

When I finished a relation after four years, leading to much á
sorrow for the other one and myself ("although it was the best á
solution").

Every time I meet a certain person. We cannot get on well á
together, we dislike each other.

I fell over head and ears in love with someone who appeared to be á
in love with me. it made me so happy that I could hardly sleep á
and eat for one week.

One night I had to bike home all alone after a party. Then I á
found out that I was pursued by a man in a car.

I had a quarrel with my father, because I was of the opinion that á
he decided in an authoritarian way which TV program we should á
watch. I became very angry and started throwing things through á
the room.

My boyfriend finished our relationship when I started studying á
psychology in Nijegen, because then we would not be able to meet á
frequently anymore.

A friend had a quarrel with the mother of her boyfriend because á
she and her friend decided to go and live together. She needed á
money for removal, then she made a great effort to reconcile.
I was called and invited to have a talk about a job I wanted to have.

Once late at night (around midnight) a person asked me to give á
him a lift. He suddenly tried to attack me but I could escape. á
After this he followed me for a little while.

There was a lot of irritation between me and a person who lives á
in the same house where I live. Suddenly it became too much for me and I á
accused him of several things.

The end of a relationship (after 4 years) by doing this I hurt á
the other person very much.

I saw a terrible accident in which the driver of a motor was á
thrown through the frontwindow of a car. His face was completely á
away.
When a friend of me came for an unexpected visit.
When I thought the house was on fire at night.

When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person. á
His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.
When the mother of a good friend of mine died.

A teacher was very blunt in his relation to a child so that the á
child was very upset when arriving at home.

After I saw my family and good friends back after staying one á
year in a foreign country.

When a good friend of mine behaved in a very cool manner to me á
for a very long time.

I was in the library of medical psychology and walked into the á
wrong direction. A man who came out of a room threated me very á
denigrating and I became very angry in a resisting manner.

A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intense á
feeling of sadness.

When an uncle of mine who is very ill started to cough wich á
sounded very dirty. (He can't help it of course).

When I go out with my friend with enough money and good sense to á
our favorite dancing.
When going out I am threatened regularly by two punk-girls.
A friend started to shout at me. He called me an old frump.

My relationship with a boyfriend was finished and I didn't á
succeed a years-course.

My father is someone I disgust. So when he comes close to me á
a feeling of disgust overwhelms me. When I stay a week-end at my á
parent's place I will remember it for long time.

When I made the winning goal during a very important football á
game.

A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent on á
a great bald field.

Seeing for the first time pictures about the so called á
"treatment" of Jewish people in Nazi-Germany during World War II.

The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at the á
moment of dying I was with her.

I was looking at a one-man show on television. He told very á
disgusting things so that I started to be disgusted with it. á
(Later on it proved that this was his intention).

When it appeared that I was not pregnant when I was several weeks á
overtime.

The same situation as with sadness. I was afraid about what my á
parents would further do to distroy my relationship.
Once again my parents distroyed a relationship.

I had this feeling when my parents distroyed a relationship with á
a boy because they thought he was bad and irresponsible.

After the accident which I described in SHAME. I came to myself á
and saw how terrible everything looked like. I disgusted myself á
and everything I saw.
A sudden end to the relationship with my first girlfriend.

I heard part of a conversation in which one talked very low about á
women.

I felt joy when I heard that I was accepted for the Free á
University in Driebergen.

When a good friend of me told me one evening that she didn't want á
to live anymore.

I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friend á
told me that she would go to travel next year with another good á
friend. We couldn't talk this out.

I was very sad when I had to leave persons with whom I had a very á
intense relationship I also had to leave the environment which á
was part of this.

I felt disgust after watching a picture on television about á
torturing political prisoners in India (this happened in the á
India of Indira Ghandi).

When my boyfriend and I went out for a dinner and subsequently á
went to his family. We had a very nice evening.

When I walk through streets late at night. This is because I and á
my friends were attacked one night without any reason for it.

When I got the feeling that I had to do all the housekeeping á
while my boyfriend didn't do anything. This happened in a period á
of exams when I had to study very hard.

When my best friend got a boyfriend. Because of this a á
relationship of ten years was finished abruptely.

I feel disgust when hearing or seeing other people being treated á
inhumanely. For example torturing in chili.
The day I heard that I passed the high school exam.

I was living in rooms in a very lonely, quiet neigbourhood. á
During the night it was very silent and this frightened me. The á
fact of being alone in that house frightened me.

We had to move to a very different city because the company where á
my father worked also moved to that place. It was very difficult á
for me to make new friends than.

A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. I á
didn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.

A girl who also hires a room in the house where I live always á
tries to make a quarrel with everyone available she disgusts me.

When Christmas holiday started, I felt very joyful when I á
finished my last exam.

I was raped once when I went through a dark alley at the back of á
our house. The man pushed me in the bushes. I fought back and á
succeeded to escape.

I was very angry at my father when he didn't give me as much á
money as my brother to use for studying. Once again my brother á
was better off then me.

When my gradmother died.  I felt very sad then ... The feeling á
started to be worse after a while.
When I ate a rotten apple.

My boyfriend was playing with my cat. He was playing games with her á
and telling nice things to her.

When I slept for the first time all alone in the house where I á
live now. A man phoned me at 2.00 am. He wanted something from á
me. I was afraid.

My boyfriend told me that I had very high demands towards him. In á
my opinion this was wrong.

I hadn't been at my parent's place for a long time. When I went to á
visit them I had high expectations, but when I was there it was á
very different from what I expected.

I read a story in the newspaper about butchers treating their á
animals very badly. They disgusted me.

During my high school time I succeeded to play a concert of á
Mozart on the piano when I gave my first performance I succeeded á
to play it very well.

When a car ran into me. The moment that I felt on the street I á
thought "This is my end, I am going to die".

When our cat was killed in a car-accident I was very angry at the á
driver of the car because he didn't take enough care.

There is a boy who I love very much. I asked him to have dinner á
with me, but he refused I don't know why he didn't go with me, á
but I felt very lonely.
I saw a dog who was eating excrements.

When I saw a good friend again after not having seen her for a á
long time.

When I slipped on a glazed frost road and a car almost ran into á
me.

When people without my permission pry in my belongings and take á
things out of it.

When I noticed that my parents were not in such a prosperity as á
most people in my surroundings.
Seeing a pornographic movie in which animals were used.

When I went to visit a friend in the hospital. She had to undergo á
an operation for rupture. I was glad to hear that the operation á
succeeded and that she was relieved of her pain.

I had an appointment with a good friend. He came 3 hours later á
than we agreed upon. During the last hour of waiting I was afraid á
something might had happened, because usally he is in time.

I worked together with another student on a computer-assignment. á
She didn't do her best and didn't prepare herself for it. She á
expected me to explain it to her.

I had a quarrel with a good friend about the fact that I didn't á
pay her a visit when she expected me to come. Hereafter I was á
very sad because it became a real quarrel.

I was hitch-hiking when a man stopped and gave me a lift to á
Nijmegen. During the ride he asked me whether I was in for fun. á
The man was fat and tatooed.

When I got the positive result of my examination to achieve the á
Bachelor Degree in Plychology.

When I was 12 years old I frequently was pursued by others and á
got sound thrashes.

My girlfriend one day went out and promised to be back at 6.00 pm á
however she first arrived at 10.00 pm, without a message (we had á
to go out that evening).
When my girlfriend decided to finish our relation.

When once again I drank too much and felt very rotten the morning á
after.
When the girl with whom I am in love smiles at me.

When biking and I felt very bad (problems with heart and á
respiration).

When a discussion resulted in an insult, which in my opinion, was á
not justified.

When I realized that it did not make much sense to start a á
relationship with a girl who was not very constructive to á
establish a firm relationship.
When I had to finish those big amounts of homework in time.
On my birthday when several good friends came to visit me.

I went to the apartment of my boyfriend and saw some people á
before his door. I thought that something had happened.

My father called me (behind my mother's back) and told me that my á
mother disapproved my behavior in the weekend. However, he didn't á
tell me the details and left me with unanswered questions.

I felt very lonely, was very dissatisfied with myself when I á
realised that I could feel very jealous of other women because á
of my boyfriend.

A scene in a film in which one man repressed another one. By á
concidence, their position was reversed. The other man was á
repressed in an identical way as he did before.

I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at á
first he had said that he would not do that.

I was very startled when, at night at 2.00 am, a boy approached á
me and yelled "I fuck you", then however he stopped and laughed at á
me.

When someone does not listen to me after having asked me to á
repeat what I said. This happened more than one time with the á
same person.
I felt very sad when I heard that a friend had committed suicide.

One night I saw a man being knocked down by two other men. The á
victim was kicked against his head.

For a few days I felt very miserable, distressed and listless, á
with crying fits. When this was over I felt very happy, although á
there was no special reason.

I was testing my new roller skates in the street, suddenly a dog á
ran barking in my direction, very threatening. I was very á
startled and terribly upset.

Out on a weekend with a group of people, everybody felt irritated á
because at night the music didn't stop in time. And at breakfast á
my boyfriend ran away because we didn't agree with him. I felt á
angry.

Recently I felt very sad without any reason. It lasted for a few á
days. There was nothing I liked in that period.

Someone told me a story of Amnesty International: a boy was á
killed and his head was put in the litter of his girlfriend. It á
looked as if she was pregnant, then she died. It is disgusting, I á
can hardly write it down.

When my boyfriend and I experience something nice or when we have á
made a nice walk together.

The weather is very bad (fog and slipperiness) the newcast á
reports many traffic accidents and my boyfriend is driving home á
and still has 60 kilometers to go.

Someone told me that he would stay at my home for one night. á
Therefore I made big efforts to make everything ok (food). One day á
before he cancelled the appointment because he had to go to á
church with his parents.

We had to take our cat to the vet for mercy killing (an á
injection).

When people are eating unsavoury (smacking, belching, speaking á
with food in their mouth, etc.).

One night I had a very good conversation with two friends. I then á
realized how worthy they were for me and how happy I was to á
have them as friends.
In the morning just before going to the dentist.

When a very close friend with whom I have a very intimate and á
bodily relationship (he had a girlfriend) started to avoid me and á
didn't want to talk to me any more.

When a good friend with whom I had an intimate relationship made á
clear that he didn't want to continue in the same way. He choose á
his girlfriend (also a friend of mine).

When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. Sometimes á
I even considered him unlikable.

My boyfriend suffered form ill health for some months, this week á
the physician told him that he was restored to health.

When going out in the weekend I have to bike 5 kilometers through á
lonely and dark polders, then I always have terrifying fantasies.

I made an appointment with a friend to drink coffee togehter. á
However, for the third time in that week she arrived an hour too á
late.

My dear hamster (called Hannes) died at the age of 2 and 1/2 years. á
His shape forced me to mercy killing (an injection).

I read a newspaper report that a little boy was forced to look á
while his sister was raped.

After the funeral of an acquaintance I felt very depressed. That á
feeling turned into joy when I heard that I had achieved a good á
grade for an examination.

I had to call someone and make an appointment for a conversation. á
I was very afraid to fail.

When, after having cleaned up the kitchen, two hours later I saw á
that there was a big mess. It irritated me very much.

One night I was called and told that the father of a close friend á
died. When I visited my friend at home and when attending the á
funeral I felt very sad.

I cannot remember exactly such a situation. But I know that á
once I went to a very dirty lavatory and that disgusted me.

When I found out that the girl, with whom I was in love, loved me á

When my mother threatened me with thrushing me of the stairs, when á

When being made look a fool by the teacher in front of the class á
